developer_quotes.quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
developer_quotes.author: Harold Abelson
developer_quotes.source: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs

developer_quotes.quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
developer_quotes.author: John Johnson

developer_quotes.quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
developer_quotes.author: Martin Fowler
developer_quotes.source: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code

developer_quotes.quote: The only way to go fast is to go well.
developer_quotes.author: Robert C. Martin
developer_quotes.source: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship

developer_quotes.quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
developer_quotes.author: Austin Freeman

developer_quotes.quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
developer_quotes.author: Kent Beck

developer_quotes.quote: Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.
developer_quotes.author: Donald Knuth

developer_quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
developer_quotes.author: David Heinemeier Hansson

developer_quotes.quote: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
developer_quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup

developer_quotes.quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
developer_quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
